alert.note: Alert for King (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 28 at 8:19AM PST until March 03 at 2:18AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Seattle WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Tolt River Above Carnation affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Snoqualmie Falls affecting King County. Snoqualmie River Near Carnation affecting King County. .A strong storm is coming in to western Washington with multiple factors that will produce high runoff and flooding. Heavy, prolonged rainfall will be coupled with some snow snow melt in low to mid elevations of the mountains from rising snow levels and strong warm and moist winds. This will drive some rivers above minor to major flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Snoqualmie River Near Carnation. * WHEN...From this evening to early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 58.0 feet, the Snoqualmie River will cause major flooding from Fall City downstream through Carnation and Duvall. Deep and swift flood waters will inundate many farms...residential areas...and roads. Flooding will occur all along the river including headwaters...tributaries...and other streams within and near the Snoqualmie River Basin. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM PST Monday the stage was 48.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 59.2 feet tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 54.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 59.2 feet on 02/10/1951. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 415 PM PST.
